title: 108_hr3098
content: The Act titled "Social Security Earnings Test Repeal Act of 2003" repeals provisions related to deductions on account of work. The "Social Security Earnings Test Repeal Act of 2003" repeals various subsections of section 203 of the Social Security Act, including subsections related to noncovered work outside the United States. Conforming amendments are made to subsections (c) and (e) of the Act. The "Social Security Earnings Test Repeal Act of 2003" repeals and redesignates subsections of the Social Security Act, including subsections related to noncovered work outside the United States. Conforming amendments are made to subsections (c), (d), and (e) of the Act. The "Social Security Earnings Test Repeal Act of 2003" includes additional conforming amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to change provisions related to benefits termination upon deportation, exemptions from reductions based on early retirement, and exemptions from reductions based on disregard of certain entitlements to child's insurance benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to change provisions related to benefits termination upon deportation, exemptions from reductions based on early retirement, and disregard of certain entitlements to child's insurance benefits. Amendments include changes to sections 202(s)(1), 202(s)(3), 202(t)(7), and 203(a)(3)(B)(iii) of the Act. Amendments are made to sections 208(a)(1)(C), 215(b)(2)(A), and 203(f) of the Social Security Act regarding penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings, benefit computation years, and deductions from benefits on account of work. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including provisions relating to rounding of benefits, earnings taken into account for blind individuals, and defining income for SSI purposes. Amendments to the Social Security Act include redefining the term 'wages' for paragraph (1)(A) to mean wages as defined in section 209, without certain limitations on remuneration amounts. Services not considered employment under section 210 are deemed employment if the remuneration is not included in the individual's net income calculation. The curr_chunk discusses the exclusion of certain payments from an individual's net earnings for self-employment purposes under title II. It also mentions the exclusion of retirement-related payments from the definition of 'wages'. Additionally, it touches on the repeal of deductions related to work under the Railroad Retirement Program. The curr_chunk amends certain subsections of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, including the removal of subsections (f) and (g)(2) and redesignating subsection (g)(1) as subsection (g). Conforming amendments are also made to sections 3(f)(1) and 4(g)(2) of the Act. The curr_chunk amends deductions under section 2(g) of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974. The amendments and repeals made by this Act will be effective for taxable years ending on or after the enactment date of this Act.
